text: Find the guide arranged by Wildfire

title: Mission Description
content: It seems Wildfire has finally sided withthe Namelessdue toMarch 7thandDan Heng's mediation.Now, your goals are crystal clear: Do your best in diplomacy with Svarog and if all fails, Wildfire will be ready for battle.To reach your goals,Oleghas arranged a guide for the crew. You probably already know who the guide is going to be...However, the person waiting for you at the designated location doesn't seem to be the dark blue silhouette that you were expecting. Instead, it's some sort of black chaos avatar...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Hook? You...

speaker: March 7th
line: This I really wasn't expecting...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So, The Moles are a part of Wildfire...

speaker: Hook
line: Th—That's right! It's me, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great! What do you want?

speaker: Sampo
line: Uh, kiddo, I think there's been a misunderstanding...

speaker: Sampo
line: I will be your guide, friends. By order of Chief Oleg...

speaker: Sampo
line: I gotta say I'm a little upset at the thought of you choosing a toddler over your old buddy Sampo...

speaker: Seele
line: Alright, alright, don't get started. But I wanna ask you something: Everyone in Wildfire knows the location of Svarog's lair. Why do we need you as a guide?

speaker: Sampo
line: *sigh* My specialties in the field, perhaps? Wildfire may know where the base is, but have they ever been inside?

speaker: Seele
line: You've been inside?

speaker: Sampo
line: ...No. But I've felt my way around the outside and picked up more than a few clues. I can help you. You have my word.

text: Let's hope you can walk the talk.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Hey, what are you trying to say!? Name me someone above or below ground that walks the talk like Sampo Koski.

text: Oleg put his trust in you...?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Hey, what are you trying to say!? You guys wouldn't have even gotten to know Wildfire without my help, right?

text: Clues for your own shady dealings, no doubt.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Hey! That's not nice! Wildfire made a request and I got on with the job.

speaker: Sampo
line: My legacy will prove that Sampo Koski was nothing but a willing and devoted servant of—

speaker: March 7th
line: Ugh, enough! Jeez! We believe you, okay? Show us the way already.

speaker: Sampo
line: Great! Stay close.

text: Open the gate to Svarog's base

title: Step Description
content: Unfortunately, the old friend with the dark blue hair is still your guide this time...To be honest, you would feel more at ease if Pitch-Dark Hook the Great was your guide...But you don't have a choice now... Looks like you'll just have to go with it and follow Sampo to Svarog's base.

speaker: March 7th
line: Sampo... Are we there yet?

speaker: Sampo
line: Do you have to ask every other minute, missy? Two more steps, just two more steps and you're there.

speaker: March 7th
line: This is Svarog's lair? I thought it'd be cold and lifeless, turns out it's pretty busy!

speaker: Seele
line: Many vagrants are staying here temporarily. Their homes were overrun by monsters.

speaker: March 7th
line: Isn't it dangerous for them to make camp right under Svarog's metal nose?

speaker: Seele
line: No. Svarog may be ruthless, but he never attacks without reason. For those with no home, this is actually a safe place to be.

speaker: Seele
line: Hm... If I hadn't moved away when I did, I'd probably be where they are right now.

text: (Listen to the first pair of vagrants near the camp, optional)

speaker: Devoted Vagrant
line: Did you hear? Those idiots got into a fight in the mine, haha! It only got settled after Boss Svarog showed up.

speaker: Devoted Vagrant
line: I've said it before — only Boss Svarog can protect us down here. Everyone should follow his lead.

speaker: Devoted Vagrant
line: Well, what do you think? Cat got your tongue?

speaker: Reticent Vagrant
line: ...Do you ever talk about anything else? I'm so tired of hearing about Svarog.

speaker: Devoted Vagrant
line: B—But it's true. What else is there to say? Take a look at all these good-for-nothings... They'd starve to death without him.

text: (Listen to the second pair of vagrants near the camp)

speaker: Vagrant Newcomer
line: Did you see those extra boxes of medical supplies at the depot? Who brought those over?

speaker: Experienced Vagrant
line: Clara, I assume? I can't think of anyone else that'd do something that generous.

speaker: Vagrant Newcomer
line: Who's Clara? Is she one of us?

speaker: Experienced Vagrant
line: Not even close! She's Svarog's trusted family.

speaker: Vagrant Newcomer
line: Family... of a robot?

speaker: Experienced Vagrant
line: Well, you'll understand when you've been here a while longer.

text: (Listen to the pair of vagrants down a slope near a robot, optional)

speaker: Earnest Vagrant
line: No, no, no! You can't insert the microcrystalline unit into the heat sink substrate like that.

speaker: Suspicious Vagrant
line: How do you know? Balaway from Miner's Lamp said that you need to pay attention to the interfaces when assembling relics.

speaker: Suspicious Vagrant
line: To make this thing move again, we need to connect the microcrystalline unit to the operating brake module. Otherwise, it's just a pile of scrap metal.

speaker: Earnest Vagrant
line: If you believe a word that senile idiot Balaway says, you're done for. The last time he acted on his own advice, he electrocuted himself.

speaker: Earnest Vagrant
line: You should be asking people with real smarts. No one is better at fixing machines than Marev.

speaker: Earnest Vagrant
line: I saw him connecting a microcrystalline conductor unit to a logic control hub to get a vibrating drill to work.

speaker: Suspicious Vagrant
line: Haha, Marev!? Him and his brother wouldn't know a real relic if it hit 'em in the face. Last I heard, he got scammed by someone selling counterfeit junk.

speaker: Earnest Vagrant
line: Ahh, you're just salty, my friend!

text: (Listen toEuniceand the other vagrant near some crates, optional)

speaker: Vagrant Rapper
line: Yo, yo, listen up. This one's for all you pretend rappers...

speaker: Vagrant Rapper
line: Internal Combustion Engine champion — 88 Degrees Bedrock — reppin' the dawn of the Underworld rap. Here's something to wake up your soul, check it...

speaker: Vagrant Rapper
line: (The vagrant is spitting fire rhymes...)

text: (Listen to the vagrant by the broken robot, optional)

speaker: Repairs-Duty Vagrant
line: Hold still. You're nearly fixed.

speaker: Grouchy Robot
line: My design has been superceded by newer models. My components are no longer valuable.

speaker: Repairs-Duty Vagrant
line: Hey! What are you talking about? I'm not interested in selling your components.

text: (After listening to any vagrants for the first time)

speaker: Sampo
line: Alas, this place is a bit of a mixed bag — plenty of... "characters." Keep your wits about you, friends. Don't let anyone deceive you.

speaker: March 7th
line: It's all good. We've had you for practice.

speaker: Sampo
line: Y'know missy, you sure know how to bear a grudge.

speaker: March 7th
line: What a heavy gate... Okay, watch this!

speaker: March 7th
line: Opennnn sesame~!

speaker: Bronya
line: Is that a secret code or something?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's an imaginary password that children like to use... and I don't think it's going to be of much use.

text: What about these clues of yours?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: I was just about to get into those, before Miss March's colorful attempt.

text: Help us pry the gate open.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Whoa, whoa! Pry it open? In front of all these vagrants and robots? They have eyes, you know.

speaker: Sampo
line: Luckily for us, I've already figured out the mechanism for this gate. They don't just let any Joe Shmoe in and out of Boss Svarog's territory. I mean, if you wanna see the big cheese himself, you need "certification."

speaker: Seele
line: Certification?

speaker: Sampo
line: Correct, only prospectors with the right certification can get in or out. These prospectors collect mechanical remnants from all over the underground, and then bring them to Svarog for him to repair.

speaker: Sampo
line: Honestly, it's a very profitable little venture. If only I'd beaten him to it... Hehe, they'd be calling me Sampo "Boss-ki" by now...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Time out. Where do we get this "certification"?

speaker: Sampo
line: That's simple. You see the robots over by the vagrants? They're all Svarog's scouts — every one of them is commanded to maintain order here.

speaker: Sampo
line: Apart from them keeping a watchful eye on these hooligans, another one of their duties is "processing." Anyone who wants to become a prospector has to pass a test from these walkin' stoplights first.

text: Do they give you a gachapon for the test?

speaker: Sampo
line: Not a clue, I never had the urge to go on a Svarog suicide mission before. You guys are the ones that want in, why not go and ask the robots?

speaker: Bronya
line: It feels like the people here are all under the supervision of robots...

speaker: Bronya
line: This would be unthinkable on the surface. Robots are merely tools in the Overworld .

speaker: Seele
line: Don't take Svarog as an ordinary robot. He's, uh... special.

title: Step Description
content: As promised, Sampo leads you to the gate of Svarog's base. He then leaves you with a cliffhanger: In order to open this gate, you'll have to collect certifications from the certification robot.If he could just tell you everything at once, you wouldn't have to waste time running in circles — this is the reason why you dread working with Sampo... One of the reasons at least.But there's no choice now... Looks like you'll just have to go with it and follow Sampo to collect the certifications.

speaker: Seele
line: This has to be one of them, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: It looks so... lame.

speaker: Seele
line: Is it even awake in there? Maybe it's broken down.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Beep... Boop...

speaker: Seele
line: Ah! That scared me.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Protocol initiating... Scanning... Verifying.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Certification failure... Subject has yet to obtain access permissions. Launching processing.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Are we starting now!?

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Launching stage one processing. Please listen to the following question...

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Who is the reigning champion of the Internal Combustion Engine Rap Tournament?

speaker: March 7th
line: Infernal construction what now? How would we know anything about that!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Sampo, do you know the answer?

speaker: Sampo
line: Sampo Koski always knows the... Wait, what did it say again?

speaker: March 7th
line: Ugh, aren't you supposed to be dependable?

speaker: Sampo
line: Well, I don't know everything. *sigh* Sometimes you've gotta ask around if you wanna know the answer. Don't panic... Let's listen in to what these vagrants are talking about, we might just hit the jackpot.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Please answer the following question: Who is the reigning champion of the Internal Combustion Engine Rap Tournament?

children.speaker: Certification Robot
children.line: Incorrect answer. Certification result: Failure.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: ...Uh, y'know friends, if you don't know the answer, you don't have to pretend you do. No one's gonna laugh at you.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Reassessing... Subject threat index: High. Initializing combat module. Threat elimination activated.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Combat module? This thing's faulty, right...?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Wishful thinking, it's about to attack!

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Correct answer.

children.text: (If the player did not exit to listen in on some conversations)

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Whoa! Was that a lucky guess? *gasp* Did you go to a music festival without us?

children.speaker: Certification Robot
children.line: Certification result: Success. Requisite certifications remaining: Two.

children.speaker: Certification Robot
children.line: Please extend your right hand.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: My right hand? Here you go. Why is this part of the— Hey, hey! Ow, ow, ow!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...So this is the certification mark?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Great, only two more steps to go. Let's move.

children.speaker: Certification Robot
children.line: Incorrect answer. Certification result: Failure.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: ...Uh, y'know friends, if you don't know the answer, you don't have to pretend you do. No one's gonna laugh at you.

children.speaker: Certification Robot
children.line: Reassessing... Subject threat index: High. Initializing combat module. Threat elimination activated.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Combat module? This thing's faulty, right...?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Wishful thinking, it's about to attack!

text: Let's listen in on some conversations...

speaker: March 7th
line: Phew...That was scary, it just suddenly attacked!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This button says "system reset." Let's give it a try.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: ...System reset... successful. Certification sequence... online.

speaker: Certification Robot
line: Please extend your right hand.

speaker: March 7th
line: My right hand? Here you go. Why is this part of the— Hey, hey! Ow, ow, ow!

speaker: March 7th
line: ...So this is the certification mark?

speaker: Sampo
line: Great, only two more steps to go. Let's move.

title: Step Description
content: As promised, Sampo leads you to the gate of Svarog's base. He then leaves you with a cliffhanger: In order to open this gate, you'll have to collect certifications from the certification robot.If he could just tell you everything at once, you wouldn't have to waste time running in circles — this is the reason why you dread working with Sampo... One of the reasons at least.You've collected the Level 1 Certification. Hurry and collect the next level of certifications.

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Beep... Boop...

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Protocol... initiating. Scanning... Ugh. I'm so sick of repeating this.

speaker: Seele
line: Ha? What did this bucket of bolts just say?

speaker: March 7th
line: Seems like this one's got a temper...

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Ugh, let's get this over with. Did you get your first certification? If not then you're wasting your time.

speaker: March 7th
line: You mean this? Here, look.

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Yeah, yeah, whatever... Here comes your question, listen up.

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Riddle me this: A microcrystalline unit should be connected to which component?

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Wrong! Congratulations.

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Simple question, terrible answer. It's back to school for you!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ ...(Trailblazer), can I smash this can opener already!?

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Huh!? You wanna go? You caught me in a bad mood, let's do this!

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: If we turn you into scrap metal, we still get our certification, right? Suits me!

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Wrong! Congratulations.

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Simple question, terrible answer. It's back to school for you!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ ...(Trailblazer), can I smash this can opener already!?

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Huh!? You wanna go? You caught me in a bad mood, let's do this!

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: If we turn you into scrap metal, we still get our certification, right? Suits me!

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Huh? Lucky guess.

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Ugh! Now I have to do this again. Put your hand out.

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: What are you doing? I meant her, give me your hand!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Huh? Me again? It hurts, y'know!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Ah! Owwww...

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: There, one step left. Now get outta here and leave me in peace...

text: Let's listen in on some conversations...

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: You don't know the answer? That's lame. It's back to school for you!

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: ...Wait, have mercy! I'm sorry! One certification, coming right up!

speaker: March 7th
line: Hehe, now we're talkin'!

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: Okay, please extend your right hand...

children.speaker: Irritable Robot
children.line: Not you, the girl over there!

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Me again? It hurts, y'know!

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Me again? It hurts, y'know!

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Ah! Owwww!

speaker: Irritable Robot
line: There you are, only one more to go. Now, please leave me in peace...

title: Step Description
content: As promised, Sampo leads you to the gate of Svarog's base. He then leaves you with a cliffhanger: In order to open this gate, you'll have to collect certifications from the certification robot.If he could just tell you everything at once, you wouldn't have to waste time running in circles — this is the reason why you dread working with Sampo... One of the reasons at least.You've collected the Level 2 Certification, just one more level until the gate opens. Keep it up!

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: Beep... Boop...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Whatever the case, we'll need it to identify our certifications.

speaker: Seele
line: There's something wrong with this one...

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: Protocol... Inish-nish-nish-nish-nish...

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: Initialization failure. Attempting system restorashhhh...

speaker: Bronya
line: Not encouraging...

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: System restoration failure. Core module damaged. External threat detected.

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: Threat elimination activated. Initializing combat module.

speaker: Seele
line: Ha! Finally, no more racking our brains. This rust bucket's about to meet its maker!

speaker: Seele
line: Ha! Learned how to behave now?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let me try and reset its system...

speaker: Malfunctioning Robot
line: ...Certification system online. Please extend your right hand.

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* ...Why is it always me...

speaker: March 7th
line: Aaaah!!! How come it hurt even more than the other two!? Hmph, at least that's the final step...

speaker: March 7th
line: We can get in now, right? Hehe, Svarog's certification system is no match for us!

speaker: Seele
line: This better work. Let's get back to the gate and give it a go.

text: Open the gate to Svarog's base

title: Step Description
content: As promised, Sampo leads you to the gate of Svarog's base. He then leaves you with a cliffhanger: In order to open this gate, you'll have to collect certifications from the certification robot.If he could just tell you everything at once, you wouldn't have to waste time running in circles — this is the reason why you dread working with Sampo... One of the reasons at least.You've collected all three levels of certifications. It's time to open the gate and meet Svarog.

text: (Interact with controller and submitRobot Settlement Level 3 Certification×1)

speaker: March 7th
line: Opennnn sesame~!

speaker: Sampo
line: See? Not so bad having Sampo on the team after all, right? Chief Oleg knew all along that I—

speaker: March 7th
line: Yeah, yeah, thank you very much.

speaker: Seele
line: I'll commend you to the chief. No need to waste your time.

speaker: Sampo
line: Alright, well let me issue a warning now: Everything from here on out is uncharted territory — we must proceed with the utmost caution...

speaker: March 7th
line: Now to set the record straight with Svarog. Let's get in there!

speaker: Sampo
line: ...Ugh! Did anyone hear what I just said?

text: Open the second gate to Svarog's base

title: Step Description
content: After tedious labor, you've finally completed the certifications the gate requires. But little did you know, there are even more gates after the one you just opened. This infuriated you. The thought of directly climbing over the gate crossed your mind...However, a Nameless can't just jump without discretion, it'd be inelegant of you.Looks like you'll have to see if the elevator over there is still working or ask what the robot by the door thinks of this.

speaker: Seele
line: A gate...

speaker: Seele
line: Ugh... Why is there another gate here!?

speaker: Bronya
line: It looks like this gate has a more complicated structure than the last one...

speaker: Seele
line: Sampo, what is this?

speaker: Seele
line: ...Sampo? Where is he?

speaker: March 7th
line: Ugh! Where did he run off to — he was just here a second ago!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...This isn't the first time.

speaker: Seele
line: It's that same type of robot again! Please don't tell me there's another round of "processing."

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Visitors for Svarog detected.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Protocol initiating... Scanning... Verifying.

text: Who's a good boy? Here's our certification, we just wanna see your master.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ooh, good plan! Treat the robots like guard dogs!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...How is that gonna improve our chances?

text: Careful, this one might have a few tricks up its sleeve.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Are we gonna smash this one too? Count me in.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Certification failure... Subject has yet to obtain access permissions.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Request rejected. Visitors must acquire access permissions from Miss Clara.

speaker: March 7th
line: Clara? Oh, the girl we saw in the Great Mine ?

speaker: March 7th
line: We need to get permissions from her? What's she got to do with this?

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: She's his "family..." Did you really forget?

speaker: March 7th
line: Family... Huh, weird.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Don't trouble yourself about it. We need to find her.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I don't know if this will work, but it's worth a try: Where is Clara right now?

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Obtaining audio data, please wait...

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: The energy core's bearing component is broken... If we don't repair it soon, the settlement will be pitch-black.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Timmy , I'm going back to Rivet Town — maybe I can recover some usable components. You need to guard the gate while I'm gone.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Recording recovery complete. Resuming execution of Clara's commands.

speaker: Seele
line: She went back? But we were just there. *sigh* Sounds like we better head over again.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, you guys went sightseeing in another town?

speaker: Seele
line: ...It wasn't as fun as you think.

text: That town has danger lurking in every corner.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: Indeed. And that little girl heading into the Fragmentum all by herself... It doesn't bear thinking about.

text: We should go and find Clara.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: That little girl heading into the Fragmentum all by herself... It doesn't bear thinking about.

speaker: Bronya
line: Her strength belies her appearance, but even so...

speaker: Seele
line: You don't look so tough yourself. Well, let's find her. Svarog's not going anywhere.

text: Go to the storage room and find Clara

title: Step Description
content: Only Clara, who has returned to Rivet Town to collect materials, has the authorization to open the second gate.Being there not long ago, you are well aware of how vicious of a place Rivet Town is. You wouldn't allow such a little girl to be exploring Rivet Town alone, even if she has a robot guardian by her side...It's time to prove that you're truly a member of Clara's family — head to Rivet Town!

speaker: March 7th
line: This is a big town. Where should we start?

speaker: Seele
line: Clara said she was going to find components, right? Let's start with Nat's storage room.

text: (Reach the storage room and investigate the damaged robot)

speaker: Bronya
line: Isn't this the robot that was following Clara around?

speaker: Seele
line: ...These can openers all look the same. How can you tell them apart?

speaker: Bronya
line: Shh, it's about to say something. Listen...

speaker: Perkins
line: Initializing self-repair module... Initialization failure...

speaker: Perkins
line: Clara... in danger...

speaker: Perkins
line: Must... protect...

speaker: Seele
line: In danger? What do you mean?

speaker: Perkins
line: Workshop... target... must be eliminated...

speaker: Bronya
line: Does it mean that a monster appeared over at the workshop? Clara, she...

speaker: Seele
line: Not good. She's in danger! Quick. Let's head over to the workshop and check it out. I know the way.

text: Go to the Tempering Workshop and find Clara

title: Step Description
content: Only Clara, who has returned to Rivet Town to collect materials, has the authorization to open the second gate.Being there not long ago, you are well aware of how vicious of a place Rivet Town is. Here, you already discovered Clara's robot guardian to be heavily damaged and learned that Clara is trapped in the Tempering Workshop all by herself...Clara is in danger — hurry over to the workshop and protect Clara!

speaker: Seele
line: Just as we feared, there's something big over there! And there's Clara — we have to save her!

speaker: Bronya
line: Let's go. No need to fear. We have the numerical advantage.

speaker: Seele
line: Are you okay, Clara? Are you hurt?

speaker: Clara
line: Th—Thanks, everyone. I'm fine. Just a few scratches.

speaker: Seele
line: You shouldn't be running around by yourself. It's too dangerous. What are you looking for here?

speaker: Clara
line: There's a fault with one of the energy supply units at the base. If I don't repair it soon, everyone at the settlement will be affected.

speaker: Clara
line: I knew there was a workshop in this town, so I wanted to try my luck here. I found all the components I need, but then I ran into a monster...

speaker: Clara
line: You guys saved me — I'll tell Mr. Svarog about it.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: ...We were planning on paying him a visit.

text: We were just about to pay him a visit.

speaker: Clara
line: ...Huh? What do you need to see him for? I can pass him a message...

speaker: Seele
line: No, this time we need to set things straight with him face to face. Can you take us to meet him?

speaker: Clara
line: But... Mr. Svarog doesn't like talking to others, especially Wildfire...

speaker: Seele
line: Don't I know it. But he's evaded communication with us for too long — this time we have to see him.

speaker: Clara
line: Um... I know you're working hard for the people down here, but Mr. Svarog doesn't trust human emotions. He only trusts his calculation results.

speaker: Clara
line: So, I can't take you to see him... If Mr. Svarog and you had a fight, someone would get hurt for sure. Maybe even bystanders...

speaker: Seele
line: Listen kid, you—

speaker: Bronya
line: Clara, you said it yourself before, right? Svarog's duty is to protect the Underworld and preserve the civilization here. We have the same wish. Why would he refuse to cooperate with us?

speaker: Clara
line: I know Mr. Svarog. He isn't affected by other people's wishes. He only follows logical judgments.

speaker: Clara
line: Terrible things are happening on this world... Mr. Svarog thinks that the Overworld will end soon.

speaker: Clara
line: According to his calculation results, the strength of the Underworlders won't be enough to prevent the disaster.

speaker: Clara
line: His plan is to keep the Underworlders away from the source of the disaster, so they can survive for longer...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Isn't that just putting us in a cage? It's ridiculous — what difference does it make if our death gets postponed a couple of days? How is that better than putting up a fight?

text: See it as returning the favor, Clara.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: I'll definitely return the favor! But not like this...

text: We have to see him, whatever the cost.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: I'm sorry... I really can't help you with this.

text: Why don't we think of another way?

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: I'm always trying to convince Mr. Svarog. Please give me more time...

speaker: Clara
line: Um, if you don't mind... I still have important things to do. I'll go back now.

speaker: Seele
line: Clara—

speaker: Bronya
line: It's no use, Seele. She's made up her mind. I could tell from her expression.

speaker: Bronya
line: We will have to think of another way...

speaker: March 7th
line: That's no ordinary kid. So young and yet so... stubborn? No, intelligent?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: She's incisive, and determined... in sharp contrast to you, March.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Did you really have to add that last part!?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It looks like we'll have to get past Clara if we want to speak to Svarog.

text: If we can't even persuade Clara...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Then good luck persuading that mass of metal.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: If we circumvent Clara and the gate, Svarog will only identify us as intruders. He'll be even more likely to give us the cold shoulder.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Isn't a robot shoulder cold to begin with?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Clara mentioned Svarog's "calculation results" many times...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The strength of the Underworlders won't be enough to prevent the disaster... Those were her exact words. For me, that's our starting point.

speaker: March 7th
line: So... you think Svarog's logic has a hole in it?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No, his calculation is correct. At its current strength, it is highly unlikely that Wildfire would be able to resolve the problems stemming from the Stellaron . However, that calculation didn't take the present situation into account. There's a new variable yet to be added to the equation...

text: We need him to recognize our value.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Precisely. If we can make Svarog believe in us, we can almost certainly overturn the result of his calculation, and we'll be one step closer to peace talks.

speaker: March 7th
line: But, how we can get him to do that... Showing him some of our photos wouldn't cut it, right?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There's always a way. But first, we have to convince Clara.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I assume she must be on her way back to the robot settlement. Let's catch up with her.

title: Step Description
content: You and your companions defeated the Fragmentum organisms and secured Clara's safety. You wanted to take the opportunity to persuade Clara into bringing you to Svarog, but she has a firmer and clearer conviction than March 7th... Your persuasion ended in failure.However, all is not lost. You've noticed a breakthrough that could make her and Svarog talk — all you have to do now is to find Clara and revisit the conversation.

text:
(Approach the gate leading to Svarog's base)
(Clara runs off in the distance)

speaker: March 7th
line: She turned that way, quick!

title: Step Description
content: You and your companions defeated the Fragmentum organisms and secured Clara's safety. You wanted to take the opportunity to persuade Clara into bringing you to Svarog, but she has a firmer and clearer conviction than March 7th... Your persuasion ended in failure.However, all is not lost. You've noticed a breakthrough that could make her and Svarog talk — all you have to do now is to find Clara and revisit the conversation.She seems to have taken the elevator and headed below theFurnace Core. You can still make it in time if you leave now.

title: Step Description
content: You and your companions defeated the Fragmentum organisms and secured Clara's safety. You wanted to take the opportunity to persuade Clara into bringing you to Svarog, but she has a firmer and clearer conviction than March 7th... Your persuasion ended in failure.However, all is not lost. You've noticed a breakthrough that could make her and Svarog talk — all you have to do now is to find Clara and revisit the conversation.You catch a glimpse of her while in the elevator — it's time for a rabbit hunt. Go after her!

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Where'd she go? We just saw her go this way.

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* We'll just have to head straight and keep looking.

title: Step Description
content: You and your companions defeated the Fragmentum organisms and secured Clara's safety. You wanted to take the opportunity to persuade Clara into bringing you to Svarog, but she has a firmer and clearer conviction than March 7th... Your persuasion ended in failure.However, all is not lost. You've noticed a breakthrough that could make her and Svarog talk — all you have to do now is to find Clara and revisit the conversation.Clara should be close by. Search carefully for her.

speaker: Clara
line: Hmm... why won't it...

speaker: Clara
line: Argh... I can't figure it out...

speaker: Clara
line: ...Oh, it's you. You came with me after all.

text: We couldn't give up that easily.

speaker: Clara
line: You keep saying that, but...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are you repairing this installation, Clara? Hit a snag?

speaker: Clara
line: Huh? How did you know?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The dimensions and wear of these two roller components look very different from the rest of the unit. You must have only just replaced them.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You replaced the damaged components, but the unit isn't starting up as normal. That's what you're trying to figure out, right?

speaker: Clara
line: ...Yeah. I've fixed a lot of things before, but I never had to repair one as complicated as this.

speaker: March 7th
line: Why isn't Svarog helping you?

speaker: Clara
line: I don't want to disturb him. This installation was... accidentally damaged by two of the vagrants. If Mr. Svarog finds out, they'll get in big trouble...

text: You give a lot of thought to others.

speaker: Seele
line: ...Y'know Clara, if you're too kind, people can take advantage of you.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I think I found the source of the problem. You replaced the rollers, but the bearing is causing a jam — there's a misalignment.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), March, give me a hand. We should be able to fix it between us.

speaker: March 7th
line: More fixing? I'm getting good at this!

text: Help Clara fix the energy supply device

title: Step Description
content: You find Clara sitting in front of a damaged energy supply device troubled with its repairs.As a member of Clara's family, this is the time to give her a helping hand and use it as leverage... No, to use it as a chance for an opportunity to convince Clara.Coincidentally, you find the energy supply device to have a similar structure to the various machines you've fixed before — it's time to display your true abilities!

speaker: Clara
line: Can we really fix this?

speaker: March 7th
line: Relax, we got this. Right, Dan Heng?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Less asking, more helping.

speaker: Clara
line: Whoa! It lit up! Thanks guys!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No need. We hardly lifted a finger. So, the settlement's energy supply problem is solved for the time being?

speaker: Clara
line: Yes. The people on the outskirts don't need to worry about heat or light now.

speaker: Clara
line: Umm...

text: We're not trying to win you over.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: I understand. You helped a lot of injured people in the mine, and you risked going into the town for supplies. You're good people.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: I know that you're good people. You helped a lot of the injured in the mine, and you risked going into the town for supplies.

speaker: Clara
line: If there's any other way I can help you, I'll do my best! But this...

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* How are we gonna convince her?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: The present situation is... we're here! This planet isn't doomed after all...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: The variable is... our arrival! No outsider's set foot in the underground for over a decade...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ ...You might be putting a little too much faith in me, (Trailblazer).

speaker: March 7th
line: Clara, you're observant, right? Take a look at us. Do we look like Underworlders?

speaker: Clara
line: Well, uhh... you do look very different from other people.

speaker: March 7th
line: Right! That's because we're not from here. We've never been a factor in Svarog's calculations. And if those calculations are based solely on "the strength of the Underworlders," then the results don't apply to the present situation.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: When did Svarog start doing his calculations, Clara?

speaker: Clara
line: It was... a long time ago. The same time the Underworld was sealed off, I think...

speaker: March 7th
line: Circumstances have changed since then — there's a Silvermane Guard down here now! Is that part of Svarog's calculation? Not to mention, we're—

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Just tell her already! We come from a different planet!

text: Three people more than when we started!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That's your big reveal? The important part is: We're from a different planet!

speaker: March 7th
line: There's just no way that Svarog's calculations would have included variables like us, y'know?

speaker: Clara
line: Different planet...?

speaker: Clara
line: D—Don't treat me like a child! Those are just made-up stories that grown-ups like to tell. I don't...

text: In other worlds, people have already conquered the heavens.

speaker: Bronya
line: ▶ Hey. (Trailblazer) and March aren't lying, Clara. I believe them.

speaker: Clara
line: Bronya, do you really...

speaker: Bronya
line: I know how you feel, Clara. You want new hope for the underground, but you don't want anyone to get hurt in the process, right?

speaker: Bronya
line: ▶ I also have doubts... But my gut tells me that March, Dan Heng, and (Trailblazer)... They are the new hope this world has been waiting for.

speaker: Bronya
line: Let them meet Svarog, and let's see if his calculation result is any different. For you, for him... there's no harm in trying, right?

text: We will bring change to this world.
Come onnnn, what have we got to lose?

speaker: Clara
line: I... Okay. I'll take you to see Mr. Svarog.

speaker: March 7th
line: Really? Awesome!

speaker: Clara
line: ...Mm. I understand now.

speaker: Clara
line: Trying to change Mr. Svarog's mind on my own would take forever. Even if I kept trying until I was all grown up, I don't think I could do it.

speaker: Clara
line: And all the while, people would be getting sick, losing their homes, and fighting... just like in the mine.

speaker: Clara
line: I don't want that to happen. If you guys really believe that you can convince Mr. Svarog... then I need to be brave too.

speaker: Clara
line: Everyone, follow me.

speaker: Seele
line: Bronya! I didn't know you'd stick up for us like that back there — well said!

speaker: Bronya
line: It was nothing. I just... said what I truly felt.

text: Enter Svarog's base with Clara's help

title: Step Description
content: "The members of the crew are the new variants. Our existence will topple Svarog's calcluations." And with that, you've completely convinced Clara and earned her trust, as well as awakened her courage and conviction to protect the world.And so Clara makes the promise to bring you to Svarog.Follow Clara back to the Robot Settlement and open the gate that leads to Svarog's base.

speaker: Clara
line: ...I'm back, Timmy.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Welcome back, Miss Clara.

speaker: Clara
line: Timmy, open the gate please. I want to see Mr. Svarog.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Outsiders detected. Do you wish to permit access?

speaker: Clara
line: It's okay. They're all my guests.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Command received. Access restriction terminal unlocked.

speaker: Wandering Robot
line: Welcome back, Miss Clara and guests.

speaker: Clara
line: Uhh... If you can, please try not to upset Mr. Svarog...

speaker: March 7th
line: It's okay, Clara! We're here to reason with him.

speaker: Seele
line: I'll leave negotiations to you guys. They're not my strong point.

speaker: Bronya
line: Negotiating with robots... I can't say I've tried it before.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), are you ready?

title: Step Description
content: The locked gates are now all opened. This is a path that must be traveled in order to change the destiny of the world.Svarog is here guarding the truth of this world...Go and face him.

speaker: Clara
line: I'm back, Mr. Svarog.

speaker: Svarog
line: I see that the energy supply system is back online. Thank you, Clara.

speaker: Svarog
line: But... why have you brought them?

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog... they want to talk to you about going to the surface.

speaker: Svarog
line: Analyzing... Analysis result: Target does not belong to Wildfire. Background: Unknown. Classification: Unknown.

speaker: Svarog
line: You have arrived on Clara's recommendation. I will give you an opportunity to speak.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Hey, sounds like he's willing to communicate! Quick, (Trailblazer), time to smooth-talk him!

text: We're not interested in stoking conflict.

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: You seek peace, understood. Nevertheless, your statement is unilateral.

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: My position will be determined after assessing the result of our negotiation.

text: We're here about the future of the underground.

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: An inadequate pretext. You are not from the underground. You have no right to represent Underworld humanity.

text: To be, or not to be, that is the question!

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: Said question lacks the necessary context to be answered.

speaker: Svarog
line: Proceed with your central point. Do not waste this world's valuable time.

speaker: March 7th
line: He cut you off completely! This guy...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Stay focused. Remember, we have to make him see that we're a variable in the calculation.

text: Do you know what a Stellaron is?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Think before opening your mouth!

speaker: Svarog
line: Stellaron...

speaker: Svarog
line: Searching database... Access denied. Discussing "Stellaron" with unauthorized targets: Prohibited.

speaker: Svarog
line: You are broaching a secret that lies at the heart of this world. A secret that should remain unknown to humanity.

speaker: Svarog
line: Reassessing targets... Threat index raised. I demand that you reveal your true intention.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: As expected... He knows of the Stellaron, but it's a restricted topic...

speaker: Seele
line: ▶ We've come this far. Out with it already! (Trailblazer), just be straight with him! Everything depends on it.

text: We must find the Stellaron, and then...
We want to bring this world's disasters to a close.

speaker: Svarog
line: Historical records state that humanity has already made multiple efforts to engage with the Stellaron. Without exception, these efforts have been motivated by human greed — attempts to secure the article for a selfish end.

speaker: Svarog
line: As instructed by the Architects : Any attempt to engage with the Stellaron will result in grave consequences. Reassessing... Target threat index critical.

speaker: March 7th
line: What should we do? This is going from bad to worse!

text: Wait, we're not like those others!

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: There is no evidence to suggest you are an exception. Calculation result remains unchanged.

children.speaker: Svarog
children.line: Target hostility significantly exceeds base index. Calculation result remains unchanged.

speaker: Svarog
line: Peacekeeping protocol temporarily disengaged... Requesting extermination protocol launch.

speaker: March 7th
line: E—Extermination? In the literal sense?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Peace talks are over — March, prepare for combat!

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog! Please, don't—

speaker: Svarog
line: Leave, Clara!

speaker: Bronya
line: Clara, it's dangerous here! Find somewhere to hide!

speaker: Seele
line: Tsk... looks like we have to take action after all.

speaker: Svarog
line: Prototype number 3, monitoring automaton Svarog, extermination protocol launch: Successful.

speaker: Svarog
line: ...Annihilation permitted!

children.text: (Battle ends when Svarog is reduced to 70% HP, where he will automatically use Shrewd Bombing)

text: (After the battle, Natasha and Sampo appear)

speaker: Natasha
line: Hah, how can you put up your best fight without a doctor on the battlefield?

speaker: Natasha
line: All of you, stay focused. I'm right behind you.

speaker: Seele
line: Nat? How did you...

speaker: Sampo
line: Guess you guys had a bad talk, huh? Luckily, Sampo's got your back!

speaker: Seele
line: Sampo! I knew you'd be involved somehow...

speaker: Svarog
line: Base breached. Armed Wildfire personnel detected. Assessing...

speaker: Svarog
line: All subjects are high-risk individuals. Commencing complete annihilation!

text: (Reenter battle against Svarog at 80% HP and allies gaining the "Wildfire Reinforcements" buff)

children.text: (Natasha primes her weapon, aiming at Svarog)

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Wait... Wait!

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Please don't hurt Mr. Svarog!

speaker: Natasha
line: C—Clara? ...You...

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog can't fight anymore! Please... Please don't hurt him!

speaker: Svarog
line: Cla...ra...

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog... Don't push yourself any further. Can you tell them what you know?

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, you said you were willing to make all my wishes come true, right? My biggest wish right now is for everyone to work together. Like... like family.

speaker: Clara
line: Recently, I learned something new... Calculation results can't always bring people happiness.

speaker: Clara
line: Even if the world outside the cage isn't beautiful... people still want to know what it's like.

speaker: Svarog
line: Assessment system reset... successful. Processing variables...

speaker: Svarog
line: Variable 1: Clara's request... Variable 2: Outsiders' intentions.

speaker: Svarog
line: ...Updated assessment result: Transference of decision-making authority to outsiders. Outsiders are granted access to Stellaron intelligence.

speaker: March 7th
line: So... So we did it?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Clara seems like the only one who can break through Svarog's cold logic. It's a good thing she was here.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah! Without her, even if we'd defeated Svarog, there's no way he'd have given us access to the intel, right?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Although, if Clara hadn't been here... Svarog would never have granted us access to the intel, right? Even up until the end.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I hope his memory bank really does contain data on the Stellaron.

speaker: Seele
line: Is this it, Nat? Us, Wildfire, the Underworld... Did... did we win?

speaker: Natasha
line: No, Seele.

speaker: Natasha
line: Our battle... their battle... it's just beginning.

speaker: Bronya
line: Finally... We finally made it to this point.

speaker: Seele
line: ...What's up, nervous?

speaker: Bronya
line: No, but... I do have an aching feeling in my chest.

text: It's up to you to make your own judgment about who's lying now.

speaker: Bronya
line: ▶ ...I'm ready, (Trailblazer). Reveal the truth. I'm listening.

title: Step Description
content: Svarog recognizes your value as a variant. You've been incorporated into the ice-cold logic of the humanoid weapon, changing the outcome of his calculations entirely.Now, it has decided to pass on the truth of the planet to you.It is completely up to you to decide how this precious information is used.

speaker: Svarog
line: I have finished collating the Stellaron data and records. Do you wish to proceed, outsiders?

speaker: Svarog
line: Requesting database materials cache. Serial number, 13175. Encryption level: Highest.

speaker: Svarog
line: Request approved. Transmission...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission To Rot or to Burn 1.mp4

speaker: Voice of Researcher
line: ...This is the fruit of many years of research, Madam Guardian. The evidence is irrefutable: This so-called "Stellaron" is the source of all the destruction.

speaker: Old Guardian
line: The people will struggle to accept this conclusion, doctor. If we were to tell them that the almighty Alisa Rand activated this thing and triggered the Eternal Freeze...

speaker: Voice of Researcher
line: It's the truth, madam... The truth won't change with the opinions of the people. The reports before you are the precious result of painstaking effort on the part of Belobog's greatest scholars. You must trust the weight of its conclusion...

speaker: Old Guardian
line: ...I have never doubted you, doctor. On the contrary, I am resolute in the face of this conclusion.

speaker: Old Guardian
line: From the moment I took up this mantle, that voice... their voice — has made its home in my mind. I cannot shake them.

speaker: Old Guardian
line: ...I shouldn't be telling you this — let's return to your research, doctor. I'm afraid I cannot make these reports known to the public. Unless...

speaker: Voice of Researcher
line: Unless? Unless what? Please proceed, madam...

speaker: Voice of Guardian
line: ...Unless you have found a way to completely destroy the Stellaron.

speaker: Voice of Researcher
line: I understand. In the name of Preservation ... I will fulfill this mission.

speaker: Svarog
line: Cache number 13175, transmission complete. Next transmission: Cache number 24830.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission To Rot or to Burn 2.mp4

speaker: Young Researcher
line: ...I don't understand, doctor. Why do we have to hide such valuable research results away? They're the work of a lifetime...

speaker: Old Researcher
line: *coughing* Y—You're still young, child. There will come a day... a day when you do understand.

speaker: Old Researcher
line: The Supreme Guardian ... sh—she sees further than you or I. All her decisions are for the security of Belobog...

speaker: Young Researcher
line: I just think... it's a shame. Our research has hit an obstacle. Meanwhile, your results will be buried in the snow...

speaker: Old Researcher
line: *coughing* Don't be upset, child. You still have lots of time ahead of you. When you find a way to destroy — *coughing* — destroy the Stellaron... our efforts will have been worth it.

speaker: Svarog
line: Cache number 24830, transmission complete. Next transmission: Cache number 57614.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission To Rot or to Burn 3.mp4

speaker: Young Guardian
line: ...This is... Why is there a robot here?

speaker: Guardian's Bodyguard
line: During his life, this was Dr. Mearsheimer 's personal robot bodyguard. I heard it's a prototype from the great war.

speaker: Guardian's Bodyguard
line: Since the doctor and his assistants passed away, it's remained here. It hasn't moved an inch.

speaker: Young Guardian
line: Oh... I see. Let's start. We must unearth the doctor's research conclusions — all of them.

speaker: Guardian's Bodyguard
line: Madam Guardian, I've found them... All the documents are here.

speaker: Young Guardian
line: Mm... good. That'll do.

speaker: Guardian's Bodyguard
line: Madam Guardian, what should we do with the robot?

speaker: Young Guardian
line: Ah... It would seem a great waste to destroy it. Find someone to reset its system and then arrange for it to be sent to the Underworld. I hear that the development group is in need of a robot with defense capabilities.

speaker: Guardian's Bodyguard
line: Yes, madam.

speaker: Young Guardian
line: I'm sorry, doctor... but these results must be taken care of by the Architects.

speaker: Young Guardian
line: One day, somebody will be able to carry out your behest.

speaker: Svarog
line: Cache number 57614, transmission complete. Concluding data transmission.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...So the truth is clear now, right?

text: They were looking for a way to destroy the Stellaron...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: And it would appear that they never succeeded.

text: I didn't quite understand. Can someone go over it again?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Putting minor details aside, this is the conclusion... Eminent individuals, not to mention the guardian herself, knew early on that the Stellaron was the source of disaster on this world.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: But in order to maintain the peace, they decided to hide the truth. Secret research detailing a method for destroying a Stellaron ended in failure.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Now only one question remains... Why would Cocolia exhibit such a sudden change in her attitude towards us?

speaker: March 7th
line: Bronya? Are you okay?

speaker: Bronya
line: ...I'm fine. I just... feel a little faint.

text: This must be a lot to take in for you.

speaker: Bronya
line: Why...? Why, mother...? M—Maybe she wasn't aware, maybe she...

speaker: Seele
line: ...I'm sorry. It's no use lying to yourself, Bronya. It's time for you to make a decision.

speaker: Natasha
line: ▶ ...(Trailblazer), can I have a word with you? I know that we'll need time to process this new information, but we have to decide on our next plan as soon as possible.

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, are you okay? Let me repair your language module first...

speaker: Svarog
line: Assessing... Language module operating as normal. Thank you, Clara.

speaker: Clara
line: Did your memory module get damaged? Maybe I can fix that too.

speaker: Svarog
line: Retrieving memory module...

speaker: Svarog
line: Architect machine era records: Intact. War of Defense combat data: Intact. Geomarrow Development Group era records: Intact...

speaker: Svarog
line: Record of Clara's crafting of miniature magnetic drill rigs: Intact. Record of Clara's explanation of human "sleeping in" behavior: Intact...

speaker: Clara
line: S—So, your memory module is okay?

speaker: Svarog
line: I have made a backup of all records pertaining to you, Clara. Do not worry.

speaker: Clara
line: ...Even the one about sleeping in?

speaker: Svarog
line: There are multiple backups. I can recover them at any time.

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, can I delete some of them...?

speaker: Svarog
line: I cannot grant this request. Records pertaining to you constitute important data, Clara. They must remain intact.

speaker: Svarog
line: They are memories of family.

speaker: Clara
line: ...I understand.

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, I still want to help you check a few other modules... Turn around a little.

speaker: Bronya
line: At daybreak, the guardian shall be a glittering star, illuminating the people's path.

speaker: Bronya
line: At nightfall, the guardian shall be a flickering flame, comforting the people's soul.

speaker: Bronya
line: So many years... Have I been following lies this whole time?

speaker: Seele
line: Hey... maybe you should find someone to talk to...

speaker: Seele
line: Don't let it get you down — you can share your feelings with others y'know? Do you think keeping it all to yourself is doing you any good?

speaker: Seele
line: You let that status of yours go to your head, huh? Afraid to show weakness? That's why you're keeping so much bottled up inside, right?

speaker: Seele
line: This isn't the Overworld. We don't do envy and etiquette down here. Whatever's on your mind, you can say it.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...I just want to be clear in myself, first. These fragments of history, the teachings I studied... It's all muddled together in my mind... I just... I don't know what I should believe.

speaker: Seele
line: ...No, you just have to be clear on what you should do.

speaker: Seele
line: You've spent long enough living in lies, Bronya. This is your chance to break out of the cage.

speaker: Sampo
line: How's it going, partner? Is that feeling in your chest the thrill of victory or just the joy of making it out alive?

speaker: Sampo
line: I know, your heart is bursting with gratitude... but there's no need to thank me. We have what I'd like to call a "fiscal friendship." If the money's right, not a problem in sight!

text: When did you call in for reinforcements?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Ha, I knew that you'd get yourselves into trouble eventually, so I got Oleg to send relief in advance. Pretty sensible, right?

children.text: I'm asking why you went behind our backs.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: My assignment was simply to take you to Svarog's lair. I got the payment and delivered the goods — I wasn't obligated to tell you about my dinner plans!

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: But I threw in something extra regardless. I only did that because we're friends, or I would've charged extra.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: My pleasure! Friends should look out for each other. Good for business.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Here's a slice of life experience for you: Resourceful businessmen never get into risky trading without a plan b... and a plan b for their plan b. Plan c, we call that.

text: You seem to enjoy muddying the waters.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Hey now, you've got me all wrong! I just enjoy watching people fight, that's all. Fierce words, fists flying... what's not to like?

speaker: Sampo
line: Easy there, don't get mushy on me now. We professional types don't have time for "thank yous." It's business! Feelings don't come into it.

speaker: Sampo
line: Hahaha~ you see? Gotcha! Hah, seriously though — Sampo will always be happy to assist you.

title: Step Description
content: You learn the truths of the world from Svarog.The Guardians tasked with the Preservation chose to purposely hide information regarding the Stellaron from the people of Belobog. The brutal truth is a shock to all.But whatever the case, the motives of the crew have been cleared — it's time to ask Natasha about Wildfire's next moves...

speaker: Natasha
line: The Furnace Core... The path to the surface is close at hand now.

speaker: Natasha
line: ▶ Thank you, (Trailblazer). What you've done has brought new hope to the Underworld. Now we have to wait and see... But maybe this will lead to a new lease on life.

text: Your support came at the right moment. Thank you.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Well, you should really be thanking Sampo. If it weren't for his intel, we wouldn't have made it in time.

text: When did doctors start carrying weapons around?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: ...I, um... I haven't been truthful with you...

speaker: Natasha
line: As Wildfire's leader, I couldn't simply look on while you fought on our behalf. We had to come help.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh...? Huh!? So, you're the real chief? Wh—What about Oleg?

speaker: Natasha
line: Oleg has always acted on my behalf — he helps me deal with all manner of problems in the Underworld.

speaker: Natasha
line: Thanks to him, I'm able to make time for the people. I do my best to make sure that they have everything they need... At the same time, I was formulating a plan to deal with Svarog.

speaker: Natasha
line: Your arrival unraveled that carefully crafted yet rudimentary plan, hehe... and for that, you have my utmost thanks.

text: You're welcome, all in a day's work for a hero.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: When the Underworld recovers its freedom, the people will indeed extol you as heroes.

text: We did it for us, it wasn't as selfless as you made out.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: A person is defined by their actions alone... I think that's how the saying goes? If the Underworld recovers its freedom, the people will see you as heroes.

text: Any chance of a more... tangible show of thanks?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: You have Wildfire's full support.

speaker: Natasha
line: However, even though Svarog is no longer sealing off the Furnace Core, there's no way that we undergrounders could go pouring onto the surface.

speaker: Natasha
line: That cold-blooded supreme guardian has used lies and tricks to keep the surface separated from the underground. If she detects any change in the Underworld, I don't know what she might resort to...

speaker: Natasha
line: As for Wildfire, we need more time to build up our strength.

text: With things as they are, you want to take a back seat?

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: No, but we need to wait for the opportune moment. In the meantime, I'm sending someone I trust to go with you.

text: It will be difficult for us to defeat the guardian alone.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Of course, there's no doubt about that. So, I'll be sending someone I trust to go with you.

speaker: March 7th
line: Seele...

speaker: Natasha
line: Didn't she tell you? In private, she insisted on accompanying you.

speaker: Natasha
line: Don't let her carefree nature fool you — she's actually very discerning, and can read a situation like no one else.

speaker: Natasha
line: Seele is a talented scout and a quick thinker — she takes decisive action. She'll definitely be able to help you. Not to mention... you also have Bronya now.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: It seems like the intel we got from Svarog caused her a significant shock... but with Seele by her side, I know she'll recover.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: You're right, but with Seele by her side, I know she'll recover.

speaker: Natasha
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), when's the last time you got some rest? I heard that you've been on your feet looking for Svarog since Rivet Town.

speaker: Natasha
line: Health is everything — you won't be much use if you neglect yours. Let Wildfire take care of the Furnace Core for now. You head back and recuperate.

speaker: Natasha
line: If you're lucky... perhaps tomorrow you can return to the Overworld.

speaker: Natasha
line: ▶ Take a good rest while you still can, (Trailblazer). Your adventures on the surface won't be easy-going.

text: So you're the leader of Wildfire.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Don't be surprised. My job is just to help everyone make the right calls.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: You remember Rivet Town? When the Fragmentum corrosion first appeared, we were defenseless. We didn't have a clue how to protect our homes.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: After we fled to Boulder Town, I made up my mind: A tragedy like that could never be allowed to happen again. That's why I gathered Oleg and the others together, and created the first sparks of Wildfire.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Afterwards, Wildfire began to grow. To be honest, I never thought a day like this would come.

text: Your "gentle doctor" act is pretty good!

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: What do you mean? That's me too, y'know. The "me" that my patients see, at least.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Our identities are like masks. When we switch between them, we change the way the world perceives us.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: But our hearts never change.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Well, we don't want to act in haste before the situation has stabilized. We need to wait for the right time.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Ten years of being sealed away has sapped the Underworld's vitality. Now that the Furnace Core is no longer blocked off, we need to prioritize the people and replenish our resources.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Wildfire has never been in this for its own gain. Everything we do is for the citizens of the Underworld. That passage is a means to an end, not the end itself.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: We'll leave them be... Svarog may have blocked off the Furnace Core, but he's provided shelter to the vagrants from the beginning. An admirable deed.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: There are many homeless people in the Underworld. If they had safety and security, they wouldn't have to struggle to survive.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Wildfire can provide that while Svarog is recovering.

text: I don't have any more questions.

speaker: Natasha
line: Things have settled for now, you should rest while you can.
